instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
Hi,
Need help with a board random backlight issue. First time i started it worked fine. Restart and no backlight. Now it's no backlight always. Checked the following and noticed 2.8v missing at  PWM Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor R7704.  
Measured the VIN voltage through capacitor C7710 - 5V.
Measured the VDDIO voltage through capacitor C7711 - 3.3V
Measured the EN Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor R7731 - 2.8V.
Measured the PWM Pin voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor R7704 -  Missing
Measured the SCLK voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor R7753 - 3.3V
Measured the SDA voltage at the 2 Pin of the resistor R7757 - 3.3V.. 
Replaced U7701 - No change..

What next?

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message: Another thing i noticed... With a flashlight at the back i can see the machine boot but it is extremely slow and keyboard and trackpad both not working. Power on off button is unresponsive and even with a battery connected it boots up without pressing the power key. Am i looking at SMC issue..

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
Did you check SMC_LID signal?
Tried another LIO board/flex and trackpad?
Checked XW7720 integrity?

You didn't mention in any moment the voltage at pin 1 of R7704.

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message: SMC_LID measured on R5171 Pin 1 - 0.65 mv. Missing...Changed the LIO board and flex cable. Swapped the board on a working machine and same issue. XW7720 check is pending as i will need to remove U7701. R7704 Pin 1 and 2 both show 0v. In the meantime, if this helps...

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
No need to remove U7701, unless you already detect corrosion underneath.
Scratch the smll area near A5 ball.

Do you have now 3V at SMC_LID?

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message: Removed U7701 and XW7720 is fine. D7701 pin 2 to U7701 A5 link is perfect. Anything else needs to be checked while U7701 is removed? Ordered a new LP8550 and should take a couple of days.

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message: You should fix SMC_LID problem, before touching U7701...

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message: What do i check for some help will be nice... But will have to wait till i get the new chip.

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message:
Replace R5171.
Check J9500 for corrosion on corresponding pin.
Still no backlight if LIO flex is disconnected?
At least SMC_LID must go high.

threads.title: MAcbook Air A1466 - 820-00165 Backlight Issue.
threads.message: Replaced R5171 and U7701 and got the backlight. PRAM & SMC reset took care of the slow booting. Thank u.
